intro: Gomphichis altissima, commonly known as the tall spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing clusters of blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
